result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harold Robert White III

records.addlTxt: Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Dec 12;  ka

9:16 AM Defendant Harold Robert White III appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Blake Gross appeared by video for Harold Robert White III.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF1, 22CF9, and 22CF166.  Case 22CF166 is here for prelim hearing and the other two cases are STC.  Atty, needs to speak with client.  Atty and def in breakout room.  Back on the record at 9:20.  Atty, def waives right to prelim hearing.  Def understands rights giving up.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court reviews complaint and finds PC that a crime has been committed in Ashland County, case is bound over for arraignment.  State filing information that mirrors the criminal counts in the complaint.  Atty, waives reading, stands mute on each charge, NG entered.  Atty expects that they all should track and hope for a global resolution.  State comments that a STC would be ok.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:02 AM Defendant Harold Robert White III appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Blake Gross appeared by video for Harold Robert White III.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF1, 22CF9, and 22CF166.  Atty Gross for cases 22CF1 and 22CF9.  Atty is unsure if representing in 22CF166 has not discussed with def yet.  Lost Atty Gross from zoom session.  Back on the record at 10:12.  Atty now in person.  County appointed in 22CF1 and 22CF9.  Atty and def in breakout room.  Back on the record at 10:38.  Atty discussed 22CF166, waives readying, waiving time limits for prelim hearing.  Atty is appointed in 22CF166.  Def, waiving time limits for prelim hearing, discussed with Atty.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Other cases to track.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.

Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
